citation.case_name: Canton Co. of Baltimore v. Comptroller of Treasury, Retail Sales Tax Div., Md.

html:
375 U.S. 58

84 S.Ct. 173

11 L.Ed.2d 122

CANTON CO. OF BALTIMORE
v.
COMPTROLLER OF the TREASURY, RETAIL SALES TAX DIVISION, MARYLAND.

No. 365.

Supreme Court of the United States

October 28, 1963

Francis D. Murnaghan, Jr., for appellant.

Thomas B. Fi an, Atty. Gen. of Maryland, Robert C. Murphy, Deputy Atty. Gen., and Franklin Goldstein, Asst. Atty. Gen., for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed for want of a substantial federal question.
